intro: Hemitelia urolepis, commonly known as the broadleaf hibiscus, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Africa and Southeast Asia. It is characterized by its large, heart-shaped leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 3 meters. It thrives in moist, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas or near water bodies. The flowers are pollinated primarily by birds and insects, contributing to its ecological importance in its native habitats.
